column4: I'm on ubuntu 11.10 32-bit and when installing nvidia driver via "Additional Drivers" I get "Sorry, installation of this driver failed."
Maybe there is a network problem.
downloading directly from nvidia will work though, right? usr13
user13: E: Unable to locate package nvidia_current
all the software sources are checked
going to restart, thanks for the help, I'll be back if problem persists
Let me look at the log again.
No such file or directory: '/var/cache/jockey/driverdb-OpenPrintingDriverDB.cache'  #I'm wondering about that...
idk why the driver was already installed (nvidia-current) but "Additional Drivers" says it isnt. I uninstalled nvidia-current and just re-installed it. Going to restart again
thanks for taking a look at it
You might also do   apt-get -f install
